name: It's Fun, It's Trivia Online Quiz | Mixed 25 Questions | 25 Questions

questions.text: Name the type of Spanish song often accompanied by dancing.
questions.explanation:
Flamenco.

	Flambeau is a burning torch used in night processions. Flambe is food such as steak or pancakes served in flaming brandy.

questions.text: Name the largest lizard in the world today.
questions.explanation:
Komodo dragon.

	It comes from Komodo and other East Indian islands of Rintja, Padar, Flores, Gili, Mota and Owadi Sami growing to a length of about ten feet and a weight of about 300 pounds.

questions.text: Which character did Charles Schulz create?
questions.explanation:
Snoopy.

	Garfield was drawn by cartoonist Jim Davis. Fritz the Cat was created by Robert Crumb and Felix the Cat was created by Otto Messmer.

questions.text: After elephant, which present-day creature is the heaviest land-dwelling animal?
questions.explanation:
Rhinoceros.

	The elephant is the world's largest land-dwelling animal.

questions.text: Who wrote 'The Wizard of Oz'?
What country was known as Malagasy Republic from 1958-1975?
What is the Italian name for Rome?
Name the Caribbean island owned by Sir Richard Branson.
Name the town in Israel which was the home of Jesus in his youth.
Who in boxing was the longest-reigning world champion holding the world heavyweight title for 11 years and 252 days?
questions.explanation:
Joe Louis.

	He held the title between 1936-1949. Rocky Marciano held the title 1952-1956.

questions.text: Who was a Greek hero of the Trojan War who was the son of Telamon?
questions.explanation:
Ajax.

	He killed himself in vexation when Achilles' armour was given to Odysseus.

questions.text: In which Jules Verne novel does Passe-partout appear?
questions.correct: Around the World in Eighty Days
options: A Journey to the Centre of the Earth
Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea
questions.explanation:
Around the World in Eighty Days.

	Passe-partout was Phileas Fogg's valet.

questions.text: Roberta Flack's, 'First Time Ever I Saw Your Face', was used in Clint Eastwood's directional debut film. Name the film.
In Greek Mythology, name the race of creatures with the head, arms and torso of a man and the lower body and legs of a horse.
Golf was banned in Scotland in 1457 as it distracted men from ...
In the television programme, 'Only Fools And Horses', where in Peckham does Del Boy and Rodney live?
Name the flesh of the calf used as food.
Which country's name is Portuguese for 'The bearded ones' named from either the bearded fig-trees or hanging vines found by the first visitors in 1583?
Which island derived its name from the Greek word for copper as it was the principal source of this metal during the 'Bronze Age'?
Vexillology is the study of ...
On what day of the year was William the Conqueror crowned king of England?
In Harry Potter, exciting lessons include charms, potions, divination and quidditch. Quidditch is a fast and furious sport played on what?
In Rudyard Kipling's 'The Jungle Book', what was the name of the tiger?
questions.explanation:
Shere Khan.

	Bagheera was the panther, Baloo the bear and Kaa the snake.

questions.text: Only five nations have been represented at all of the first twenty-four summer Olympic Games. Australia, France, United Kingdom, Greece and ....
Which country possibly derives its name from 'Mountain Vomiting Water'?
questions.explanation:
Guatemala.

	This refers to the volcano of water which erupted on 8th Sept. 1541 and engulfed the original Spanish capital of Ciudad Vieja. Hope you learnt something new from the quiz.  Or possibly the name means 'Land of Trees'.
